listOfExercises.exerciseDescription: Start with your knees and hands on the floor. Adjust the distance between your knees and hands so that your body becomes straight. Execute the exercise by lowering and pushing up.
A bodyweight exercise where one pushes their body up starting from a prone position using their arms. Only the toes and hands must be in contact with the ground.

Similar to the normal push up, this is a bodyweight exercise where one pushes their body up. However, the difference here is that you want to raise the feet above the body using a block or bench. This exercise requires more strength as more weight is put on the hands.
Load the bench press with medium weights to tire out the muscle. Make sure to control the weight on the on the way down, and up.

Load the bench press with a heavy load for maximum muscle activation. The goal is to move the weight from point A to point B, so you need to coordinate well but don't stretch out the movement longer than needed.
Load the bar with the weight you.
Load up the calves heavy and use ankle extension for maximum results. Low rest time so that you feel the burn.
The lat pulldown is a fantastic exercise to strengthen the latissimus dorsi muscle, the broadest muscle in your back, which promotes good postures and spinal stability.
The shoulder shrug is an exercise in weight training used to develop the upper trapezius muscle.
The farmer’s walk, also called the farmer’s carry, is a strength and conditioning exercise in which you hold a heavy load in each hand while walking for a designated distance.
A pull-up is an upper-body strength exercise. The pull-up is a closed-chain movement where the body is suspended by the hands and pulls up.
Stand with your feet hip distance apart, with your arms at your sides. Then, simultaneously raise your arms out to the sides and over your head, and jump your feet out
16 reps forward, 16 reps backward to get the shoulder joints warm
Alternate between legs. Can do on the spot or 'lunge-walk' around
aka Back extensions, can strengthen lower back muscles.
Deadlifting trains most of the muscles in the legs, lower back and core.

listOfRoutines.routineDescription: Starts from easy exercises and gets progressively more difficult.

listOfRoutines.routineDescription: Hardest part about this routine is overcoming the urge to skip it.

includedExercises.exerciseDescription: No equipment needed, bring hips at or below knee level.
Load the bar with the weight you.
Good exercise for hamstrings.
Load up the calves heavy and use ankle extension for maximum results. Low rest time so that you feel the burn.

3x2 minute rounds
